tp:treatment-sec.p:
The species of the
irroratus
group can be distinguished from other species groups of
Inca
by: outer dorsal margin of clypeal horns of males with an acute or rounded tooth (this tooth is outwardly directed); distal area of parameres acuminate; clypeus of females with a posteromedian process and disc convex; medial tooth of the anterior margin rounded (see Table 1 ).
